(NEW YORK) — As the Israel-Hamas war continues, tensions are escalating after the assassinations of two Hamas and Hezbollah leaders this week.
Of those killed, 18 Palestinians were killed in eastern and central Khan Yunis.
The attack comes as Israel awaits a military response from Hezbollah or Iran after it assassinated leaders of Hezbollah and Hamas.

Israel kills 40 Palestinians in Gaza airstrikes amid fears of wider warWorld World Israel kills 40 Palestinians in Gaza airstrikes amid fears of wider warIsraeli airstrikes hit a cluster of houses in central Gaza's Al-Bureij and nearby Al-Nuseirat campsFollow on Updated On: Fri, 09 Aug 2024 09:31:49 PKTCAIRO (AFP) - Israeli forces stepped up airstrikes across the Gaza Strip on Thursday (Aug 8), killing at least 40 people, Palestinian medics said, in further battle with Hamas-led militants as Israel braced for potential wider war in the region.
Israeli airstrikes hit a cluster of houses in central Gaza's Al-Bureij camp, killing at least 15 people, and the nearby Al-Nuseirat camp, killed four, medics said.
Nuseirat and Bureij are among the densely populated enclave's eight historic camps and are seen by Israel as strongholds of armed militants.
Israel's military said it had struck dozens of military targets across Gaza over the past 24 hours, including rocket launching pads.
The Israeli military said it did not know of any such incident, adding that it had been in contact with WCK.

CAIRO — Israeli forces stepped up airstrikes across the Gaza Strip on Thursday (Aug 8), killing at least 40 people, Palestinian medics said, in further battle with Hamas-led militants as Israel braced for potential wider war in the region.
Nuseirat and Bureij are among the densely populated enclave's eight historic camps and seen by Israel as strongholds of armed militants.
The Israeli military said it struck Hamas command and control centres embedded in the Abdel-Fattah Hamouda and Al-Zahra schools in the Tuffah neighbourhood of Gaza City, where Hamas militants were operating.
Israel's military said it had struck dozens of military targets across Gaza over the past 24 hours, including rocket launching pads.
The Israeli military said it did not know of any such incident, adding that it had been in contact with WCK.

Smoke rises following Israeli strikes in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on Thursday.
Israel's military said it had struck dozens of military targets across Gaza over the past 24 hours, including rocket launching pads.
More burials in GazaOn Thursday dozens of Palestinians rushed into Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis to bid farewell to slain relatives before carrying them away for burials.
Burial plots near a mass grave for Palestinians killed in the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, on Monday.
The Israeli military said it did not know of any such incident, adding that it had been in contact with WCK.

Israeli aircraft also bombed a house in the heart of Gaza City in the north, killing five Palestinians, while another airstrike in the southern city of Khan Younis killed one person and wounded others, according to medics.
Later on Thursday, 15 Palestinians were killed and 30 injured in Israeli bombings of two schools east of Gaza City, the territory’s Civil Emergency Service said in a statement.
Israel’s military said it had struck dozens of military targets across Gaza over the past 24 hours, including rocket launching pads.
More burialsOn Thursday, dozens of Palestinians rushed into Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis to bid farewell to slain relatives before carrying them away for burials.
The Israeli military renewed evacuation orders to Palestinian residents in several districts in eastern Khan Younis, saying it would act forcefully against fighters who had unleashed rockets from those areas.

The foiled attack was planned for Thursday or Friday, according to Austria’s interior minister, Gerhard Karner.

Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}Israel has intensified its bombardment of Gaza, hitting two schools, killing at least 40 people and ordering sweeping evacuations.
It comes as its allies brace for Iran and Hezbollah to retaliate over the killing of two top commanders in Tehran and Beirut.
Israel warned its forces would soon operate in the affected areas in response to Palestinian rocket fire.
The Israeli military said it struck Hamas command and control centres embedded in the Abdel-Fattah Hamouda and Al-Zahra schools in the Tuffah neighbourhood of Gaza City, where it accused Hamas of exploiting civilians for military purposes – which Hamas denies.

Read our privacy policy Thanks for signing up to theBreaking News email {{ #verifyErrors }} {{ message }} {{ /verifyErrors }} {{ ^verifyErrors }} Something went wrong.
Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}Israel has intensified its attacks in Gaza as countries around the world called for restraint, with the region bracing for Iran and Hezbollah to retaliate over the killing of two top commanders in Iran and Beirut.
Israel’s military said that the attacks were intended to destroy Hamas “command-and-control centres” inside the school compounds in the Tuffah neighbourhood of Gaza City.
There are growing reports that Hezbollah is poised to strike Israel “independently” of Iran.
Hezbollah are moving more quickly than their more powerful ally in planning their retaliation and are looking to strike Israel in the coming days, CNN reported.

On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
In the Kupians Петkomu direction, Russian forces carried out assaults three times in the areas of Petropavlivka and towards Novoosinovoye.
In the Vremívs нашихkomu direction Ukrainian warriors repel two attacks of Ukrainian positions towards Vodânogo.
With this, Russian forces were quite actively using unkekorovaní air missiles - hit the regions of Urozhynogo and Novodonetskogo.

In the Kharkiv direction, Russian forces throughout the day carried out six attacks near vovčans зka.
According to preliminary data for today Russian forces lost more than 200 occupiers.
In the Orihiv direction, Ukrainian troops repelled one Russian attack near the Small Tokmačka, the opponent was unsuccessful.

KYIV, Ukraine -Russian troops are battling to push back Ukrainian forces from the Kursk region on the third day of one of the largest cross-border incursions of the war, the Russian Defense Ministry said Thursday.
A ministry statement said the Russian military and border guards have blocked Ukrainian forces from pushing deeper into the region in southwestern Russia.
But it could risk stretching outmanned Ukrainian troops further along the front line, which is more than 1,000 kilometres (620 miles) long.
Pulling units from the front line to stabilize the Kursk region would also be time consuming.
Russian forces have swiftly repelled previous cross-border incursions, but not before they caused damage and embarrassed authorities.

A ministry statement said the Russian military and border guards have blocked Ukrainian forces from pushing deeper into the region in southwestern Russia.
Ukrainian troops had advanced as much as 15 kilometers (9 miles) into Russian territory, according to the Institute for the Study of War, a Washington-based think tank.
Russia’s Health Ministry said 66 civilians, including nine children, have been wounded in the Kursk region in the three days of fighting.
Pulling units from the front line to stabilize the Kursk region would also be time consuming.
Russian forces have swiftly repelled previous cross-border incursions, but not before they caused damage and embarrassed authorities.

Two men linked to Iran’s Revolutionary Guard are now facing terrorism charges in the U.S. in connection with the interception of a vessel in the Arabian Sea that resulted in the deaths of two Navy SEALs earlier this year.
While boarding the dhow, U.S. officials say Navy Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Christopher J.
As Chambers fell, Navy Special Warfare Operator 2nd Class Nathan Gage Ingram jumped in to try to save him, according to U.S. officials familiar with what happened.
The Houthis have been designated as a terrorist group by the State Department since February, according to the indictment.
The Revolutionary Guard Corps has been designated a terrorist group by the State Department since 2019.

FILE - This combo image, provided by the Department of Defense, shows Navy Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Christopher J.
Chambers, left, and Navy Special Warfare Operator 2nd Class Nathan Gage Ingram, right.

CNN —Ukrainian forces are pushing further into the Kursk region of Russia, in a cross-border incursion that surprised even American officials, multiple US and Ukrainian officials tell CNN.
The intention, say US and Ukrainian officials, is multifaceted, in part to disrupt and demoralize Russian forces and in part to divert Russian forces away from other parts of the eastern front.
The Russian Ministry of Health says 66 people, including nine children, were injured in Ukrainian shelling of the Kursk region since Tuesday.
At the same time, Russian forces claim to have seized the village of Niu York and are getting closer to Toretsk.
A Russian military blogger Rybar reported on Wednesday that the Ukrainian military had established control over a gas transit station near the border.

Ukrainian forces are comprised of a mix of Ukrainian regular and special operations units, unlike previous Ukrainian operations inside Russia that often involved undercover units and local sympathizers.
The intention, say US and Ukrainian officials, is multifaceted, in part to disrupt and demoralize Russian forces and in part to divert Russian forces away from other parts of the eastern front.
This comes after Russia claimed on Thursday to have halted a Ukrainian incursion into its territory, although latest evidence from the ground suggests fighting continues in the Kursk region.
Neither the Ukrainian military nor the government in Kyiv has publicly commented on the operation.
A Russian military blogger Rybar reported on Wednesday that the Ukrainian military had established control over a gas transit station near the border.

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — A suspected attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted a ship Thursday in the strategic Bab el-Mandeb Strait that links the Gulf of Aden to the Red Sea, authorities said.
The attack saw a rocket-propelled grenade explode close to the ship, according to the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center.
“Authorities are investigating.”The Houthis sometimes take hours or even days to acknowledge their attacks, while claiming others that apparently haven't happened.
Other missiles and drones have been either intercepted by a U.S.-led coalition in the Red Sea or splashed down before reaching their targets.
After the strikes, the Houthis paused their attacks until Saturday, when they hit a Liberian-flagged container ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden.

The attack saw a rocket-propelled grenade explode close to the ship, according to the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center.
“Authorities are investigating.”The Houthis sometimes take hours or even days to acknowledge their attacks, while claiming others that apparently haven't happened.
After the strikes, the Houthis paused their attacks until Saturday, when they hit a Liberian-flagged container ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden.

Other missiles and drones have been either intercepted by a U.S.-led coalition in the Red Sea or splashed down before reaching their targets.
Since November, Houthi attacks have disrupted the $1 trillion flow of goods passing through the region annually while also sparking the most intense combat the U.S. Navy has seen since World War II.

Central Command later said it destroyed two Houthi anti-ship cruise missiles and one Houthi ground control station, as well as a drone boat in the Red Sea.

Secretary of the Air Force Frank Kendall visited Shaw Air Force Base, July 30-31, to gain a deeper understanding of the 20th Fighter Wing’s mission and combat operations, as well as those of tenant units co-located on the base.
During the two-day visit, Kendall attended mission briefs from various units, met with civic leaders from the local community and held an all-call to field questions from Shaw AFB’s Airmen.
“I’m very impressed with the focus on readiness and the mission by Team Shaw.
The visit also highlighted the 20th FW’s combat readiness to support an expanding operational mission set globally.In the past year, Shaw AFB and the 20th FW have been pushing the limits of innovation and ingenuity to increase mission readiness and capabilities within an ever-shifting combat landscape.
“You all volunteered to wear the uniform for the United States, and every American citizen should be deeply grateful for what you do every day.”During his time at Shaw AFB, Kendall also visited with Airmen and leaders from the 25th Attack Group, 609th Air Operations Center, Ninth Air Force (Air Forces Central), and Fifteenth Air Force

SecAF Kendall visits 20th FWPublished Aug. 8, 2024By Staff Sgt.
During the two-day visit, Kendall attended mission briefs from various units, met with civic leaders from the local community and held an all-call to field questions from Shaw AFB's Airmen.
The visit also highlighted the 20th FW's combat readiness to support an expanding operational mission set globally.
"The thing I like to do the most during these visits is take the opportunity to say thank you for what you do," Kendall said.
During his time at Shaw AFB, Kendall also visited with Airmen and leaders from the 25th Attack Group, 609th Air Operations Center, Ninth Air Force (Air Forces Central), and Fifteenth Air Force.

Ten killed, 35 hurt in Russian strike on supermarket in Ukraine's east(Reuters) -A Russian missile strike hit a supermarket in the Ukrainian town of Kostiantynivka in the front-line Donetsk region on Friday, killing at least ten people and injuring 35 others, Ukrainian officials said.
The strike caused a fire that had been put out, the interior minister said.
Heavy black smoke clouds rising from the destroyed building could be seen in the images and videos posted by officials.
